meal_plan:
## Weekly Meal Plan (OMAD - One Meal A Day) for Weight Loss

This plan provides approximately 1243 kcal, 62g protein, 155g carbs, and 41g fat per day.  Remember to adjust portion sizes slightly based on your individual needs and hunger levels.  This is a sample plan and may need adjustments after a few weeks based on your progress.  Consult a doctor or registered dietitian before starting any weight loss program.

**Since this is an OMAD plan, only dinner is included.  The calorie and macro targets are met within this single meal.**


**Day 1: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl**

* **Meal Name:** Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
* **Ingredients & Quantities:**
    * 1 cup cooked quinoa (120g)
    * 1 cup chopped cucumber (100g)
    * 1/2 cup chopped tomatoes (80g)
    * 1/2 cup Kalamata olives (50g)
    * 1/2 cup chickpeas (85g, canned, rinsed)
    * 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese (30g)
    * 2 tbsp olive oil (30ml)
    * 1 tbsp lemon juice (15ml)
    * Dried oregano, salt, pepper to taste
* **Preparation:** Cook quinoa according to package directions.  Combine all ingredients in a bowl and toss gently.
* **Estimated Calories & Macros (approximate):** 700 kcal, 30g protein, 100g carbs, 35g fat
* **Notes:**  Adjust feta cheese quantity if needed to accommodate lactose tolerance.


**Day 2: Lentil Curry with Brown Rice**

* **Meal Name:** Lentil Curry with Brown Rice
* **Ingredients & Quantities:**
    * 1 cup cooked brown rice (195g)
    * 1 cup red lentils (180g, cooked)
    * 1/2 cup chopped onion (60g)
    * 1/2 cup chopped carrots (70g)
    * 1/4 cup chopped spinach (30g)
    * 1 tbsp curry powder
    * 1 tbsp coconut oil (15ml)
    * Salt, pepper to taste
* **Preparation:** Sauté onion and carrots in coconut oil. Add lentils, curry powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in spinach and serve over brown rice.
* **Estimated Calories & Macros (approximate):** 750 kcal, 35g protein, 110g carbs, 30g fat
* **Notes:**  Add more vegetables like cauliflower or peas for extra fiber and volume.


**Day 3: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Tofu**

* **Meal Name:** Vegetable Stir-Fry with Tofu
* **Ingredients & Quantities:**
    * 1 block firm tofu (200g), pressed and cubed
    * 1 cup broccoli florets (100g)
    * 1 cup sliced bell peppers (100g)
    * 1/2 cup snow peas (50g)
    * 1/4 cup soy sauce (60ml)
    * 1 tbsp sesame oil (15ml)
    * 1 clove garlic, minced
    * Ginger powder to taste
* **Preparation:** Stir-fry tofu until lightly browned. Add vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.  Add soy sauce, sesame oil, and garlic.
* **Estimated Calories & Macros (approximate):** 720 kcal, 40g protein, 90g carbs, 38g fat
* **Notes:** Use a non-stick pan to minimize oil use.


**Day 4: Black Bean Burgers with Sweet Potato Fries**

* **Meal Name:** Black Bean Burgers with Sweet Potato Fries
* **Ingredients & Quantities:**
    * 1 can (15oz) black beans (425g), rinsed and mashed
    * 1/2 cup cooked quinoa (60g)
    * 1/4 cup chopped onion (30g)
    * 1 tbsp chili powder
    * Salt, pepper to taste
    * 1 large sweet potato (200g), cut into fries
    * 1 tbsp olive oil (15ml)
* **Preparation:** Combine black beans, quinoa, onion, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Form into patties and cook in a pan or bake. Toss sweet potato fries with olive oil, salt, and pepper and bake until crispy.
* **Estimated Calories & Macros (approximate):** 780 kcal, 45g protein, 120g carbs, 32g fat
* **Notes:**  Experiment with different spices to adjust the flavor.


**Day 5: Veggie Packed Pasta Primavera**

* **Meal Name:** Veggie Packed Pasta Primavera
* **Ingredients & Quantities:**
    * 1 cup gluten-free pasta (150g) cooked
    * 1 cup broccoli florets (100g)
    * 1 cup asparagus spears (100g)
    * 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes (100g)
    * 1/4 cup zucchini (50g)
    * 2 tbsp olive oil (30ml)
    * Garlic powder, salt, pepper to taste.
* **Preparation:** Cook pasta according to package directions.  Sauté vegetables in olive oil. Combine vegetables and pasta; season with garlic powder, salt, pepper.
* **Estimated Calories & Macros (approximate):** 750 kcal, 30g protein, 115g carbs, 35g fat
* **Notes:**  Add other vegetables like mushrooms or bell peppers.


**Day 6: Chickpea and Vegetable Frittata**

* **Meal Name:** Chickpea and Vegetable Frittata
* **Ingredients & Quantities:**
    * 1 can (15oz) chickpeas (425g), rinsed and drained
    * 1 cup chopped vegetables (e.g., spinach, onions, peppers, zucchini) (200g)
    * 6 large eggs (300g)
    * 2 tbsp milk (30ml)
    * Salt, pepper, herbs (e.g., oregano, parsley) to taste
* **Preparation:** Whisk eggs and milk together. Add chickpeas, vegetables, salt, pepper, and herbs. Pour into an oven-safe pan and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20-25 minutes or until set.
* **Estimated Calories & Macros (approximate):** 730 kcal, 40g protein, 90g carbs, 30g fat
* **Notes:**  Feel free to substitute other vegetables according to preference.


**Day 7:  Big Salad with Lentils and Avocado**

* **Meal Name:** Big Salad with Lentils and Avocado
* **Ingredients & Quantities:**
    * 4 cups mixed greens (200g)
    * 1/2 cup cooked lentils (90g)
    * 1/2 avocado (100g)
    * 1/2 cup chopped cucumber (50g)
    * 1/4 cup chopped red onion (30g)
    * 2 tbsp olive oil (30ml)
    * 1 tbsp lemon juice (15ml)
    * Salt, pepper to taste
* **Preparation:** Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss gently.
* **Estimated Calories & Macros (approximate):** 710 kcal, 35g protein, 100g carbs, 38g fat
* **Notes:** Add other vegetables and toppings as desired (e.g., roasted sweet potatoes, sunflower seeds).



## Grocery List

**Produce:**

* Cucumber - 2
* Tomatoes - 1 pint (500g)
* Kalamata olives - 1 jar (200g)
* Onions - 2 medium
* Carrots - 1 bunch
* Spinach - 1 container (200g)
* Broccoli - 1 head
* Bell peppers (assorted colors) - 2
* Snow peas - 1 container (200g)
* Garlic - 1 head
* Ginger - 1 knob
* Sweet potatoes - 2 large
* Asparagus - 1 bunch
* Zucchini - 1 medium
* Avocado - 1
* Mixed greens - 1 large container (400g)
* Cherry Tomatoes - 1 pint (500g)


**Proteins:**

* Chickpeas - 3 cans (425g each)
* Red lentils - 1 cup (200g)
* Tofu - 2 blocks (400g each)
* Black beans - 1 can (15oz/425g)


**Dairy & Alternatives:**

* Feta cheese - 1 container (150g)
* Milk - 1/2 cup (120ml)


**Grains & Bread:**

* Quinoa - 2 cups (240g)
* Brown rice - 1 cup (195g)
* Gluten-free pasta - 1 package (500g)


**Pantry Items:**

* Olive oil - 1 bottle (500ml)
* Coconut oil - 1 jar (500ml)
* Sesame oil - 1 bottle (250ml)
* Soy sauce - 1 bottle (500ml)
* Curry powder
* Chili powder
* Dried oregano
* Salt
* Pepper
* Garlic powder
* Lemon juice


**Snacks & Treats:**  (None planned within the OMAD context, focus on the single meal)


**Beverages:**  Water throughout the day.


**Note:** Quantities are estimates and can be adjusted based on your preferences and portion sizes.  Consider buying organic produce whenever possible.  This list assumes you have basic cooking equipment and spices on hand. Remember that this is a sample plan; adjustments may be needed for optimal results. Always consult a healthcare professional before making significant dietary changes.
